Sentencas: La0.4Sr0.5Ba0.1TiO3 (LSBT) is a promising anode candidate with perovskite structure, due to its excellent chemical stability even in sour hydrocarbons.
Titulo: Powering Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Syngas Using La0.4Sr0.5Ba0.1TiO3 Anode Infitrated with Nano-composite

Sentencas: Infiltrating nano-composite catalysts into the perovskite substrate can further enhance the electrochemical activity without undermining the robustness of the anode in light hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Powering Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Syngas Using La0.4Sr0.5Ba0.1TiO3 Anode Infitrated with Nano-composite

Sentencas: This paper focuses on developing a new LSBT anode with enhanced catalytic performance and chemical stability in syngas and hydrogen fuel by infiltrating the substrate with Cu+Co and CeO2+Cu+Co nano-composite catalysts.
Titulo: Powering Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Syngas Using La0.4Sr0.5Ba0.1TiO3 Anode Infitrated with Nano-composite

Sentencas: It was found that CeO2+Cu+Co significantly improved the chemical and thermal stabilities of the anode.
Titulo: Powering Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Syngas Using La0.4Sr0.5Ba0.1TiO3 Anode Infitrated with Nano-composite

Sentencas: However, an excess of infiltration reduced the active sites.
Titulo: Powering Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Syngas Using La0.4Sr0.5Ba0.1TiO3 Anode Infitrated with Nano-composite

Sentencas: The SOFC cell with the LSBT anode, which was infiltrated with 9.0 wt.% CeO2 + 3.6 wt.% Cu + 5.4 wt.% Co, exhibited much improved electrochemical performance in syngas environments.
Titulo: Powering Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Syngas Using La0.4Sr0.5Ba0.1TiO3 Anode Infitrated with Nano-composite
